text.0: first agni sprang to life from out of heaven the second time from us came jātavedas.
text.1: thirdly the manlysouled was in the waters the pious lauds and kindles him the eternal.
text.2: agni we know thy three powers in three stations we know thy forms in many a place divided.
text.3: we know what name supreme thou hast in secret we know the source from which thou hast proceeded.
text.4: the manlysouled lit thee in sea and waters mans viewer lit thee in the breast of heaven.
text.5: there as thou stoodest in the third high region the steers increased thee in the waters bosom.
text.6: agni roared out like dyaus what time he thunders he licked the ground about the plants he flickered.
text.7: at once when born he looked around enkindled and lightened heaven and earth within with splendour.
text.8: the spring of glories and support of riches rouser of thoughts and guardian of the soma.
text.9: good son of strength a king amid the waters in forefront of the dawns he shines enkindled.
text.10: germ of the world ensign of all creation be sprang to life and filled the earth and heavens.
text.11: even the firm rock he cleft when passing over when the five tribes brought sacrifice to agni.
text.12: so among mortals was immortal agni stablished as holy wise and willing envoy.
text.13: he waves the red smoke that he lifts above him striving to reach the heavens with radiant lustre.
text.14: like gold to look on far he shone refulgent beaming imperishable life for glory.
text.15: agni by vital powers became immortal when his prolific father dyaus begat him.
text.16: whoso this day o god whose flames are lovely prepares a cake o agni mixt with butter.
text.17: lead thou and further him to higher fortune to bliss bestowed by gods o thou most youthful.
text.18: endow him agni with a share of glory at every song of praise sung forth enrich him.
text.19: dear let him be to sūrya dear to agni preeminent with son and childrens children.
text.20: while agni day by day men pay thee worship they win themselves all treasures worth the wishing.
text.21: allied with thee eager and craving riches they have disclosed the stable filled with cattle.
text.22: agni the friend of men the somas keeper vaiśvānara hath been lauded by the Ṛṣis.
text.23: we will invoke benignant earth and heaven ye deities give us wealth with hero children.
